item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Horde
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
All Princess checks yielding support/social or special/investigative are now confirmed Blue Dragon, giving none off these Horde roles the claimspace to really claim those.

This means they can claim Knight/Butler/Drunk/Hunter safely. Butler and Drunk claims don’t hold up for longer than 2 nights. Knights will be forced to CS. Hunters are unique retribution monsters. Simultaneously it will never be fun to roll these classes anymore, because optimal strategy for town is to just lynch those immediately. Every game should be massclaiming day 2, because there is no ultimate bypassing mechanic that could kill Prince for instance.

The problem with no conversion is that once you’re confirmed, you’re confirmed for the rest of the game. This faction is nowhere near OP enough to deal with that.

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Horde
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
So I came up with an idea for a faction without conversion and would like to know what everyone thinks! It was fun to design even if nothing like it ever gets implemented.

All Horde games begin with 1 Chieftain and 3 Barbarians. There is no conversion and the starting King is always Blue Dragon, who’s trying to defend his kingdom from a barbarian invasion.

There are no Sheriffs or Paladins, nor any class designed specifically to counter The Horde. Observer’s Peek is the only ability that can determine if someone’s faction is Horde.

The Chieftain

Horde Killer

Brutal (Passive) - You are immune to death, occupation, and target-changing.
Noble Savage (Passive) - You may step up during the Royal Blood phase. You will become The Barbarian King.

Slay (Night ability) - Use a Barbarian to attack a player. (Infinite uses)
Slaughter (Night ability) - Attack someone, bypassing death immunity. Additionally, force every Barbarian to attack their target. (1 use)

Rabble-Rouse (Day ability) - Change all abstain votes to execute if you voted execute, or pardon if you voted pardon. (1 use)

The Barbarian

Horde Offensive

Uncivilized (Passive) - You will be demoted to The Brute if The Chieftain or The Barbarian King dies. If you become King, you will become The Brute King.

Brute Force (Night ability) - Occupy a player. (2 uses)
Wreak Havoc (Night ability) - Redirect a player. (2 uses)

Stun (Day ability) - Prevent a player from speaking or even reading chat for 10 seconds. (1 use)

The Brute

Horde Killer

Uncivilized (Passive) - If you become King, you will become The Brute King.

Raid (Night ability) - Vote to attack a player. All Brutes will attack the target with the most votes. If no consensus is reached, one of the voted targets will be chosen at random. Bypasses death immunity if multiple Brutes successfully attack the same target. (Infinite uses)

The Barbarian King

Horde Killer

Brutal (Passive) - You are immune to death, occupation, and target-changing.

Slay (Night ability) - Attack a player. (Infinite uses)
Slaughter (Night ability) - Attack someone, bypassing death immunity. Additionally, force every Barbarian to attack their target. (1 use unless you already used it before becoming King)

Royal Finger (Day ability) - Your next vote for treason will count twice.
Decide Fate (Day ability) - Pardon or execute the player on trial, ignoring all votes.

The Brute King

Horde Special

Royal Finger (Day ability) - Your next vote for treason will count twice.
Decide Fate (Day ability) - Pardon or execute the player on trial, ignoring all votes.
